greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Characteristic function of primitive nondeficient numbers (A006039): a(n) = 1 if proper multiples of n are all abundant, and proper divisors of n are all deficient, 0 otherwise.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..65537
Index entries for sequences related to sigma(n)
formula: a(n) = [A341620(n) == 1], where [ ] is the Iverson bracket.
mathematica: a[n_] := Boole[DivisorSum[n, 1 &, DivisorSigma[1, #] >= 2*# &] == 1]; Array[a, 100] (* _Amiram Eldar_, Feb 22 2021 *)
program: (PARI) A341619(n) = if(sigma(n)<(2*n), 0, fordiv(n, d, if((d<n)&&(sigma(d) >= 2*d), return(0))); (1)); \\ After code in A071395
xref: Cf. A006039, A071395, A337690 (inverse Möbius transform), A341620.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Feb 21 2021
